I played a bit of Dwarf Fortress yesterday. I tell a lie: once you wrap your mind about it, DF is one of those games you start playing for an hour or so, and then – bam! – four a.m. It’s as much fun as I remember, I finally managed to get one of the alternate tilesets to work (this one), so it looks a whole lot prettier and easier to understand. And the dwarves are as mental as ever. My fortress is currently at around 20 dwarves, tottering on the edge of a food crisis (as near as I can tell: no fish, no animals, no nothing. My vegetarian dwarves are unhappy). A newly arrived caravan should keep things going for a while, but I need to read up on farming and fast.

If you are at all interested in a game that’s sort of SimCity meets Close Combat meets very unhappy dwarves, you should start with the epic story of Boatmurdered, the epic story of one Dwarf Fortress game that spiraled horribly out of control. A good place to start the story is at Update 1.

(More coherent information about Dwarf Fortress is available on the usual wiki).
